title: Yasuo into mundo top
body:
If you play yasuo top please ban mundo.

I had this one game where I played mundo against yasuo top. My internet dced at the start so I was about 6-7 minutes behind. I got to lane and farmed under tower for a while, until he was 6 and I was 5. Then I walked over and autoed him to death. He was under his tower the rest of the game.

Then the reverse happened, the yasuo was on my team. And he got owned. He kept trying to push his lane too, and just died over and over again. Then he'd complain about "oh such a low skill champion, mundo missed ever skill shot". Complaining isn't going to do anything, instabanning mundo will.

So please yasuo mains it doesn't matter if you get executioners call first, it doesn't matter if you are m7, it doesn't matter if you hit every tornado, and it doesn't matter if mundo misses every cleaver. Cleavers are not his main source of damage and picking yasuo into mundo top is asking for a loss.

Wait wtf why in the world would you ever think Sylas loses late game to Nasus. Sylas gets to build full AP but Nasus doesn't meaning he can fully utilize it. Sylas has conqueror and access to Zhonyas which is very important because he can Zhonyas and the %HP aura still continues going. What is Mundo intended to be?

As I see it he is a very simple champ by items land skill shots use itemization to both build against the enemy team and forma  wall while providing sustained damage that works in a long team fight.

If Mundo is not a Tank what is? He has stat growth and his kit gives incentives for getting more tank stats, He is not complicated and I think that is fine not every champion has to be hyper dash heavy and require combos. He also can't do that all game and early game bullying really hurts him and delays his late game stats and tank based team fighting. He is also one of the only tanky champions in a game that can soak up damage most others champs just die super fast because of all the damage obviously there are others but few can just survive like Mundo can.

Is it Because he doesn't build active items? I am curious why A Tanky champ cannot just be a simple and build tanky.

The role you describe is a juggernaut, and Mundo doesn't fill that role in a remotely interesting way. Anivia can form a wall, Taliyah can form a long wall, Trundle can form a short wall. Mundo doesn't form anything. He just exists.

And Mundo seems to be the true early game bully, tossing out cleavers with substantial damage but nearly no cost or CD, which opponents must dodge (although that's really difficult, given the projectile speed) because the slow is so strong that it'll make dodging follow-up shots impossible. That cleaver literally starts with more damage and 33% lower CD than Ziggs Q. And that's _minimum_ damage. While Ziggs and other mages actually have to build offensively to increase the damage they deal, Mundo's damage scales automatically while he builds defensive items.

I suppose some of this is based on a difference of opinion on what is interesting - I find Regen Tanking things interesting and exciting and he doesn't just exist he still has to interact through his cleavers auto attacks and decision making if you hit zero keys on the keyboard Mundo will do nothing and not succeed. 

Also people who build offensively deal way way way more damage than Mundo and he can be killed  I dunno I enjoy that Mundo is a simple champ whose entire Idea is "Recover health and build tanky you won't deal a ton of damage but you will survive a bunch. Dealing a bunch of damage isn't all that interesting or fun for every player and having options that are the opposite of that is a good thing.  Not everything in this game should just be. If he hits a cleaver, he'll run you down and kill you with more cleavers. If he doesn't hit a cleaver, he'll just keep throwing cleavers. A Mundo flowchart would consist of a single box labeled "throw cleavers." There are interactive regen tanks in the game, but Mundo isn't one of them.

Again its a difference of opinion on whats interesting and exciting -  I can agree Mundo is not super complex and thus doesn't have a billion different outcomes to every scenario and there is room in the game for that. The closest thing to a "interactive" regen tank I can think of would be Aatrox and I find him incredibly boring combos and 1000 options are not the sole indication of what is interesting or exciting. The game needs more than just hey now you can scale into more damage.

More defensive options that are actually effective against all the damage, More CC and movement that isn't just a delivery system for more damage. If the other sustain tanks are just "do More damage to sustain more" then why make more than one?

Aatrox's method of regenerating health has interactions with both his skill and his opponents'. He can't get that regen if he's out of combat, if he misses his abilities, if his enemies dodge his abilities, if he's CC'ed... Meanwhile, there are no such restrictions with Mundo's regen. He presses a button and that's it, double health bar. And it's (for some reason) balanced around enemies applying GW to him 100% of the time. If that doesn't happen, he's basically unkillable, by design - a terrible design.

"Do more damage to sustain more" is much better than "do nothing to sustain more," which is what Mundo has. It's one of the worst designs in the game.
